item.title: VIM Cheat Sheet
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: Multiple Files Buffers Command Info :edit foo edit a file in a new buffer :read foo or :read !foo read a file or output of shell command :bn or :bnext go to the next buffer :bp or :bprev go to the previous buffer :b4 go to buffer number 4 :bf go to first buffer :bl go to last buffer :b foo<TAB> go to buffer foo :bd delete a buffer (close a file) :ls or :buffers list all open buffers set hidden hide buffers when abandoned Windows Command Info :sb foo<TAB> split window and edit file / buffer :sp or :sp foo split window in two or edit file in new split window :vs foo<TAB> open a file in a new buffer and vertically split window :vert sb N open buffer #N in left vertical split :vert belowright sb N open buffer #N in right vertical split CTRL-W + or - inc.
